text: A wide angle shot of Prince Mahidol Hall, from the Borommaratchachonnani gate Prince Mahidol Hall () is a concert hall of Mahidol University and the largest concert hall of Thailand, located in Phutthamonthon District, Nakhon Pathom. The hall was named after Prince Mahidol Adulyadej. The hall was inaugurated on 14 April 2014 by Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn and a performance by the Thailand Philharmonic Orchestra. The hall was also chosen by Tokyo Philharmonic Orchestra on its 100th Anniversary World Tour 2014 list.The 100th Anniversary World Tour 2014 in Bangkok Tokyo Philharmonic Orchestra The architecture concept based on physical structure of human and plant. The roof has two layers in order to cut off a noise from outside, the inner layer covered with a distinctive material, the outer layer covered with copper. == References == == External links == * * Official Website Category:Music venues in Thailand Category:Opera houses in Thailand Category:Music venues completed in 2014 Category:2014 establishments in Thailand Category:Mahidol University Category:Buildings and structures in Nakhon Pathom Province
title: Prince Mahidol Hall
